Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
The Canon IXUS 300 HS digital camera is somewhat confusing: the HS at the end of its name denotes neither high speed nor high sensitivity. However, it supports both high-speed video capture and has a high sensitivity lens that allows it to take photos in even very low light. Go figure.
Another oddity is that the Canon IXUS 300 HS comes in four colours and several finishes. There's a black brushed metal version that's quite grippy and a silver metal version that looks and feels quite different from it. There are also two 'exclusive' versions onsale in Jessops and John Lewis respectively, that come in white and red and are ultra-shiny. They look as though they have plastic surrounds but are also actually metal.
Canon IXUS 300 HS: Low-light legend
What is unchanged from a ... ny other Canon Ixus camera we’ve tried is the excellent build and the quality optics. When we first picked up the Canon IXUS 300 HS we were surprised by how heavy it is. At 177g, its solidity is noticeable; in some ways reassuring. There’s a large strip of flash bulb embedded at the top left on the front. Other than that the version we had for review was all black bar splashes of colour denoting the iAuto mode, playback and zoom functions.
Our first test of its mettle was in the suitably dimly lit surroundings of London’s Circus Bar, where a pair of burlesque performers twirled and whirled and performed fire-eating, sword-swallowing and acrobatic feats. A big challenge for a humble compact camera, the Canon IXUS 300 IS was nevertheless able to slip in to low-light mode and produce subtly lit but well-balanced photos that captured the atmosphere.
The performers' constant movements were a challenge for the 3.8x optical zoom, but we got some good shots. The iAuto mode here triggered a rather too bright flash, but with flash deactivated and a high manual ISO setting selected, we were able to get fuzz-free results that weren’t marred by blurring.
Canon IXUS 300 HS: Video functions and special effects
We were also pleasantly surprised by the low-light abilities of the Canon IXUS 300 HS's video-recording mode. Activated by a simple slider on the top of camera, this captures 720p video and has a likable low-light option so you can play back memorable footage in slow-mo – ideal for action replays. If we had to choose between the Canon's quality 720p resolution video capture and HS mode or standard speed capture but with 1080 video capture on a lesser-brand camera, we’d choose this every time.
Canon hasn't gone overboard on the number of settings and special effects you can apply to photos, but there's a fun diorama effect and some colour swap and colour accent options (the latter two also appear in the video options) that allow you to have only the primary subject in colour with saturation applied to other objects so they are less prominent. This selection colour option is particularly effective when shooting scenes with lots of distracting items that detract from the main action.
Manual settings are always accessible. With the camera button (denoting manual functions) selected on the top slider, press the central Func Set button on the back to bring up a scrollable options list. Sub-menus for each one then appear. More indepth settings and setup tools fall under the big Menu button on the lower right of the Canon IXUS 300 HS camera – ISO and compression and so on can be adjusted here.
Canon IXUS 300 HS: Outdoor shots
We were fortunate to have some blistering sunshine when testing the Canon IXUS 300 HS outdoors. The result: some brightly coloured shots of sunny London days out worthy of a tourist brochure. Colours popped off the camera's 3in LCD preview screen and translated just as well to the computer screen. Rainy and overcast days didn’t stop the camera producing pleasing results – greys, blues and off-whites were also pleasingly reproduced, with a good tonal range and impressive accuracy. Importantly, we saw no sign of battery fatigue after three solid days of being out and about shooting (and reviewing onscreen) everything... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Little known fact: Canon's range of digital Ixus cameras turned 10 in May this year.
Since then, cameras such as the Ixus 105 IS and 200 IS have made a huge difference to consumer photography.
The 10-megapixel Canon 300 HS is another step up for pocket-sized photography - a small, beautifully-designed camera with stonking image quality and a massive feature list.
And, with an f/2.0 lens and maximum ISO of 3200, it promises excellent low-light performance.
We're big fans of the design. As we've come to expect from Canon's glamorous Ixus line, it's svelte, at 54mm high, and its 100mm width makes it easily pocketable.
The matte black finish on our review model proved a little more divisive, with some concerned it could be more prone to scratches if slipped c ... arelessly into a pocket already occupied by a set of keys.
It does feel well-made, though. The metal chassis feels like it will resist dents and fractures, and although the 300 HS is small, it's easy to grip without feeling like you're in danger of dropping it.
The most eye-catching feature on the back of the Canon 300HS is the huge 3-inch, 16:9 widescreen display.
Unsurprisingly, this isn't the world's most convenient aspect ratio - the 300 HS, like most compacts, captures images with a 3:2 aspect ratio, which means there's a fair amount of dead space on the monitor.
On the plus side, this space is cleverly used, keeping shooting information from crowding your composition. There is, however, a 16:9 capture mode, which produces 3,648 x 2,048 images.
The screen itself is a 230,000-dot display, which is par for the course these days, but still, the reputation of Ixus cameras for having bright, sharp displays continues. Indoors or outdoors, we never struggled to make sense of what was going on. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Use, Great shooting modes, Large LCD, Great Value, Sandpaper Finish (no slips), High Megapixel, HD video
As an amateur photographer, I have purchased many digital cameras (both SLR and Point & Shoot). I have always purchased Canon as I prefer their product preferences, quality, value and warranty operations. I recently jumped into a lake with my Canon PowerShot 1300 in my back pocket and had to replace it. It was a costly mistake, but I couldn't be happier with the result. I did some quick research and found that the best buy/value on a new point and shoot would be this camera (PowerShot HS300). When I got it home I was completely blown away by all of the features that weren't even advertised on the box. There are multiple shooting modes that can simulate certain s ... hooting modes you can only do with a DSLR. There is a "miniature effect" which shoots like using depth of field or macro focus. There is a "poster effect" which looks like a vignette (which can be done in photoshop), and even color and black and white filtering effect! I couldn't believe the capabilities this tiny camera packs. It features the fastest processor on the market, takes crisp clear pictures at 12 Mega piels, large 3 inch LCD screen, awesome battery life, and best yet... FULL HD VIDEO! The outer shell of the camera is finished in a way that makes it feel like a fine sandpaper which is great for those like me who frequently drop things or let them slip out of their hand (or pocket). I've never been happier with a camera purchase, and for around $225 - $240 you simply can't beat the value. I would have easily paid over $300 for this camera! Highly recommended to ANYONE in the market for an EXCELLENT camera! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for all around use.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Auto adjustment.
Cons: Finish shows scratches easily
This is my first Digital Camera I have purchased. I am used to a SLR with 35mm film or one time use cameras. I enjoy using my cell phone to take pictures but I was looking for something to work better in low light situations. I needed something that could take up close pictures of metal objects with minimum effect from the flash. I also wanted better quality pictures of my children as they are getting older and I want to record more of their childhood. Up close pictures of metal is outstanding. I can count the pits from rust and see amazing detail when viewed on my computer. The effect on the flash is minimal. This will work great for the items I will post on ebay. Of course my 4 yr old boy can use this be ... tter than I can out of the box. At 6 ft away I can see the dirt on his face while using the Auto mode. This is using the flash and in low light with the light behind him. Impressive. I did note some contrast when not using the flash but still superior to many other products. When using the flash I can take a picture of an unlit room and see great detail. I would judge the lag between photos good. For the battery and size I would judge the flash recovery excellent. I've only seen this quick of recovery from external batteries connected to professional level flash systems. The video playback on my computer is jumpy just as Canon warns it may be. But HD videos on a Blu Ray level videos are like that anyway when played back on my computer. I will try to playback feature straight to my television later. There are plenty of functions I have yet to use and much to learn. I do enjoy the ISO settings and have yet to program my own settings to get a great picture but the potential seems very promising. I did note however that the case is a matte finish and less metallic than others. The store demo unit was heavily scratched. I do enjoy the finish regardless. The battery is rated for only 220 pictures per charge but so much better than 36 per roll. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review of Canon Powershot HS Digital Elp
Item.Review: I bought a Canon Powershot 300 HS from B and H Photo a couple of weeks ago, and so far I've been very satisfied with this compact unit. Over the years, I've owned two other Powershot cameras, including an SD 980 IS. Comparing the 980 IS with the PS 300 , the latter camera is smaller and thinner, yet many of the buttons are bigger, making it easier to use than the older model. I also like how Canon moved the Auto/Program switch onto the back of the unit, and they've included a one-touch recording button for video capture. The 12 MP CMOS sensor and wide angle zoom lens that stretches from 24 to 120mm are great features for any compact camera. and there's gobs of other features on the 300 HS that I will probably never use, such as slow motion video and effects for stills. I've always be ... en a straight shooter, and any enhancement I make is usually in post production. Anything not to like? Well, I miss the touch screen of the SD 980, and I wish that the 300 HS used the same battery as the SD 980 so I can have a spare for each camera. I'm also trying to get used to the continuous AF function on the 300 HS. Again, the touch screen on the SD 980 wins out because it's easier to work. Some users have complained about the rough texture of the 300 HS camera's body, but I like it because it really helps you keep a grip on the camera. Of course, it's always a good idea to use the hand strap too, due to the small size and lack of handle grip featured on EOS bodies. What about the pictures? Absolutely fantastic images, with saturated colors, sharp and well defined pictures that rival anything I've seen from a small camera. I've always liked Canon Powershot cameras, and this one is a winner as far as getting great shots. And I don't normally use a compact camera to shoot video, but I've experimented a bit with the 300 HS, and I'm very impressed with the quality of the HD video coming out of this tiny camera. In conclusion, I think that Canon has produced another winner with the 300HS. It's a very powerful point and shoot camera, which I'll be taking with me everywhere I go. It produces stills and videos that are far superior than any cell phone, and if you're willing to carry an extra device, you'll be rewarded with quality images that photo enthusiasts crave. expand » « collapse

Previously owned the Canon Elph 100 HS which was a pretty decent camera. Traded in for the 300 HS and have been more than happy with my decision..especially for $30 more! Both cameras take the most amazing pictures in low light even when it is zoomed in to the max! When I say amazing I mean no other cameras (in its price range) I've tried can compare! Both has great features. My favorite: Color Accent, smart shutter with smile detection, and Toy Camera. The 300 HS is smaller, has a smaller LCD screen but records videos in 1080p and is able to zoom in while recording. The 100 cannot zoom and records ... in 720p. The 300HS is also made of higher quality materials I believe. The 100 feels like plastic. The 300 feels like sturdy metal. When I take out the battery it doesn't feel like it can easily break! Overall the 300 HS was exactly what I wanted feature, looks, feel and price wise/ Hope that convinces you to buy the 300HS it really is a great camera and its super tiny and portable. Also, if you don't want to buy the 300HS because of the sandpaper feel....buy the RED...its smooth. Only the black ones are grainy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My wife and I wanted a small pocket sized camera that would allow us to leave our DSLRs at home during short trips. Our requirements were basically this: Small enough for front jeans pocket with the ability to get good shots in most situations. We just wanted to get print worthy snapshots with no extra baggage. This camera has fit the bill perfectly. For one, is is super fast (not as in aperture, as in from time to press the on button to ready to take a pic). The camera is ready to shoot within 2 seconds of pressing the on button. We have thrown every imaginable situation at this camera and it did great. As to be expected, extremely low light conditions are not that great, the one area our previous Sony point and shoot was better at. However, the focus on this camera has never onc ... e let us down, something out particular Sony became notorious for. The shooting modes are neat. Nothing you couldn't pull of in PS or Lightroom, but still fun. The 240 fps video mode is great fun, but the resolution when shooting in super slow motion isn't the greatest. HD video looks great, if that's important to you. We took this time to set the camera to full manual settings and it did great, but as it is a compact, getting to the correct settings is cumbersome without physical knobs and buttons for these settings. But that's what you have an SLR for, right? Photo quality has been great from this camera. I can't imagine any other camera this compact offering better image quality. To put it bluntly, it will not replace your DSLR, but for a camera that is much smaller than most higher end point and shoots, you can absolutely feel confident that your family vacation pics are in good hands. There are a couple of other alternatives that are a bit more appealing, but this camera strikes the right balance between size, image quality and price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Awesome replacement for my aging Canon A570 IS
Item.Review:
Pros: Great picture and HD quality! Especially from the older SD940IS and SD1300/SD1400 models. Had a 940 IS last year and was very disappointed in picture quality, especially HD. New HS system from Canon works wonders!
Firm and solid metal casing. Plastic also feels pretty sturdy. Location of HDMI and USB ports in MUCH better location then 940IS.
Rotating zoom button MUCH better then SD1300/SD1400's toggle switch
Metal tripod mount, thank you Canon!
120fps/240fps Slow motion video works well and is alot of fun! Been waiting for this for ages on a Canon camera!
Tons of picture modes
Buttons feel sturdy
720p and 1080p video!
True optical zoom in movie mode at long last!! Praise Canon!
Instant movie record button is nice instead ... of flicking through menus or a dial button to record a movie on the fly
Cons: Flash a bit weak, but thats to be expected with a camera this small, don't expect far off lighting with this guy.
Menu layout can't be changed, even colors
LCD could use a pixel increase, but thats a minor gripe, it looks very good overall and runs smooth.
No true manual mode, kinda sad, all my previous Canons had it. Owell, gain some, lose some.
Battery has low rated capacity but I was still able to take at least a 75-100 photos plus HD video during a single day and did not have the battery warning go off, so this isn't a real problem for me, for others it might.
Optical zoom motor is audible in movie mode if the movie is recorded in a quiet environment
No included mini HDMI cable *im being picky here*
After waiting years for the "just right" replacement for my beloved Canon A570 IS and being really disappointed in Canons 940IS last year, Canon did almost everything right with the Elph 300 IS! Its a remarkable camera all around, especially considering what it can do in such a small size and price! I do alot varied picture and movie taking, from small macro shots of computer and RC parts to filming low angled videos of RC car races to low light exposure shots and so far, the Elph 300 has done a great job! Its so small and portable that I can slip it into my pocket and take it out quickly and easily for my needs! The black color has a nice textured and gritty feel to it which gives you a better grip of the camera vs the silver or red colors. Unless your a real picky photographer or camera guru, you'd be hard pressed to find anything better in the price range for an excellent, do it all, point and shoot camera then the Elph 300 IS! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent Camera, especially in low light
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, build quality, speed, ISO performance, price, features, video
Cons: Does not have optical viewfinder (This is an industry move, not just Canon)
This is an amazing little camera and the price was right. I got mine in a package deal with a 4GB 30X SD Card, extra battery and case.
I am going to start our saying that this is a great camera for a point and shoot. The 12.1-megapixel backside illuminated CMOS image sensor with a 5x optical zoom lens that provides a 35mm-equivalent range of 24-120mm, a generous wide-angle to a moderate telephoto. The auto focus is responsive and quite fast. The additional shooting modes are great, such as selective color, replace color, panorama, etc. The camera is nearly instant on, so you do not have to worry about missing specia ... l events. The optical image stabilization is right on and keeps all of your shots jitter free. Which leads me to my only complaint that I will discuss in the build.
Build: My only complaint is not limited to Canon. The removal of an optical viewfinder from point and shoot cameras. This is not only important in framing your target, but it helps steady the shot. This is especially true of small cameras. It also helps in bright sunlight when you cannot see the LCD. Regardless, the industry is removing them
The build of the 300HS is awesome. Some have complained about the rough texture of the body, I LOVE IT. You can grip this camera and not worry about it slipping out of your hand. I looked at the SX230, another great camera, but the body was a little too slick. The ELPH300 is a nice solid camera and will fit in your hand quite nicely.
Indoor Shots: Absolutely amazing! You can read other reviews across the web and they will all tell you the same thing. The results are fabulous. It is one of the best cameras this size that has the ability of shooting great in low light settings. You will not be disappointed. Using AUTO mode in this situation will help those who want to just take pictures.
The ELPH 300 HS has a higher quality video mode: 1920 x 1080 resolution (full HD) at 24 fps, compared to 1280 x 720. It also has several really great features, includin ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I currently own a 5D Mark II and was looking to replace my Canon S80 which is now 6 yrs old. While I love the S80 and the quality pics it captured, the bulkiness of this point-and-shoot (P&S) became inconvenient. My wife was adamant she wanted a more compact P&S this time around. In addition to great pics, I was looking for a P&S with 1080p video capability so I wouldn't have to get a separate camcorder. Let me say that the 300 HS is a quality camera packed into a sleek body that I can easily slip into any pocket on the run. Most Canon cameras (I am a Canon loyalist) take great shots. But what most impresses me about this camera are its low-light capabilities. It obviously can not match the image quality of a DSLR, but for a P&S, I was impressed! Indoor night shots o ... f my kids WITHOUT flash (incandescent lighting only) come out amazingly crisp with minimal noise. Autofocus is quite impressive as it tracks faces in the frame further enhancing ease of use. Menu functions are quite intuitive (if you've owned previous Canon models). It's got plenty of preset shooting modes. And it's quick between shots for a P&S (a couple seconds with flash photography). I also compared the 1080p video vs Flip Ultra HD which shoots in 720p. The video quality is like night-and-day with the 300 HS finishing ahead by a mile. Low-light video is grainy but still watchable (unwatchable on Flip). In daylight, video looks beautiful. Video is easily imported into both iphoto and imovie. I did purchase an extra battery after reading battery life can be short. I've had the camera a week and have used it for 15-30 minutes daily (including video capture) and I have not needed to recharge yet. I'd also recommend the black body as it has a textured housing that makes holding this small camera much easier. Overall, considering the excellent quality of the camera, easy portability, and great price, this camera is worth every penny. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great compact camera for beginners or experienced
Item.Review:
Pros: Perfect for video's. Easy plus smooth & quiet zoom
Cons: Nothing. It does what I bought it for.
Compact and easy to use. So far, it's been rugged as I carry it in my pocket every day. You can set the program mode to do special shots and it's only a click away. Having a direct video button is a big plus as you can shoot video as quickly as taking a photo. The battery life is good enough. So far I haven't had to buy a backup. I think I got a lot for my money. Well worth having, regardless of what your experience level is, as It's nice to always have a camera handy.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice screen, ok pictures, bad cfl shots
Item.Review:
Pros: big screen, small size
Cons: interior cfl bulb shots
The camera takes great outside pictures. We have CFL bulbs in nearly all our house. When in auto mode the pictures turn out very yellow. I adjust for that by setting the white balance to a different setting and it turns out ok, still a little too yellow. I just have to remember that if i'm inside, use program mode, if outside use auto. My 10 yr old canon 5mp camera didn't have this problem. outside pictures turn out great. battery life is longer than i expected. Flash seems to be in an inconvenient spot -- half of the times i cover it with one finger. Seems to be the best value for a pns right now.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: pretty color
Cons: everything
Wish I could have rented one before relying on ratings. Instructions lacking. Buttons close together causing changes in modes, distance(and no, I don't have fat fingers-I am 110 lbs and a grown adult). Camera holder is too small for camera and extra battery-had to buy a cell phone carrier to hold both. All in all, disappointed. Focus time long, zoom slow and instructions very poor!-battery does not keep charge-either of them-for more than about 100 pictures. Need one to rent? Mine is available.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent, fast Camera! Great in low light!
Item.Review:
Pros: Very fast operation, Great in low light
Cons: Reduced sound on videos while zooming
I needed something fast. This seemed to be the fastest camera in my price range at the time I bought it. It takes excellent photos in low light. The macro mode is the best I've seen. The finish is a little bit like sand paper (black color only) and I actually like it (didn't at first). It helps the camera feel stable in my hand.
One negative is that when you zoom in and out while recording video, it lowers/ alters the sound... it's like some sort of noise reduction is being employed. I'd personally rather just hear the zoom's motor myself, but there's no option I've found that allows for this. Also, the battery doesn't last as long as the Canon SD1200 camera I had before, but it's ... still not too bad.
On the plus side, mine was made in Japan (some are made in China). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have purchased this camera to replace aging (but still functional) Panasonic P&S that did not support HD video recording. Canon has a nice finish (silver) and it is very small. It is appealing to my wife which calls my Nikon P300 boxy. We have tested the camera inside and outside. So far the results are good but I would have to say that the Panasonic with Leica lens takes better indoor pictures. It is most likely due to the weaker flash on 300HS. As to the functions, everything is clearly marked and the amount of buttons is pretty much perfect for the small P&S. I would have to mention is that be aware that the black version has different texture than the silver one. Black model has sandpaper-like texture which my wife did not like and we had to exchange the camera for a silver ... one. Also, when you press MENU on the camera there is no way to change the picture size setting. You need to press different button to change that. It wasn't very intuitive at first. For that I have deducted one star. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I research everything to death, so when it came time to replace our aging Canon I looked at reviews on Consumer Reports and CNet. Canon rates high pretty consistently and this camera seemed to get good reviews. Great price from Best Buy, too.
We've been very happy with it in the couple of months that we've owned it. It's very light and small, easy to carry. If you've had a Canon digital camera in the last 5+ years, the layout and controls will be very familiar. The pictures look great, not pixelated, and the video is pretty good too. Even the flash works well. Really, my favorite part is how quickly the picture is snapped after you push the button - we have a baby and you can capture that fleeting smile right away (the old camera seemed to take forever).
Downsides? The auto c ... olor balance seems a little off. In the same room, with the same lighting, some pictures come out looking yellow and some not. The zoom isn't the best either. It's only 5x for the regular zoom, and once you're past that into digital land it looks pretty bad. I think that's mostly standard for these small cameras though.
Overall very happy, and I would buy another one of these if the baby destroyed this one (!). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Performance, Price, Functions, Small Size
Cons: Hard to read in sunlight, some delay between snaps
It is hard to imagine a better camera for the price. Easy to use, compact, very good optics, multi-functional. Battery life better than reviews have indicated. Good low light camera. Only difficulty is seeing image screen in sunlight - would be nice to have a view finder, but that would introduce cost and other issues. Would abslolutely recommend this to anyone short of a professional photographer.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: great camera for the price range
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, photo and video quality.
Cons: Battery door feels cheap, the flash location needs getting used to.
First what I like. The photos come out great but you might not want to use auto. I find the the the pics comes out fuzzy, sometimes on the auto setting. Useing the program-portrait mode seems to work out great. The video is quality is a major up grade from my 4 year Samsung. Clean,crisp and good lighting. The lag time between shots has been at longest around 3 seconds, tops. With good lighting there is very littel or no lag time at all. The power burst mode that lets you take somethig like 5 shots in a second, something I only thought you could get with much mor pricey camera. Works great. Overall it is a great camera that takes great shots, if your in the right mod ... e. What I do not like is getting to the mode, they are all lumepd together. It will take getting used to. However, the video is just one button you press to go right to video mode. The flash is in the extreme left hand siide while shooting, so becareful where you have your fingers (I am used to the center). The battery pack door is "weak", I am hopeing I do not break it with my large hands. This is a great camera , and for the money, you would have a hard time finding a better one. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: good camera but needs better autofocus
Item.Review: I own a T2i as well as this point and shoot. It took me a while to get used to the fact there there aren't a whole lot of options with this camera. Camera: The auto mode will allow you to choose use auto tracking and auto flash. Auto tracking will focus on whatever is in the center of the screen. Program mode will give you a little more control. Three shooting modes (macro, normal, and infinity), exposure, and four flash modes (auto, on, slow synchro, and off). Overall, the shots are decent and the shutter lag is great compared to some others that I've used. It's around 300ms for those that like numbers. Video: There's not much to the video really. All you are given is the record button and off it goes. There's no control over anything. I recorded my son's Christmas performance in scho ... ol and a large part of the video was out of focus. It's hard to see it in the small screen but once it's on a 52 screen, all the flaws are realized. I guess I'm coming from a DSLR but I want more controls. if you are looking for granular controls look else where. However, if you just want to pull it out of your camera and start shooting, this is the camera for you. The photos are great in a well lit outdoor environment and not too shabby in normal indoor lighting. I haven't done too many shooting in the dark, so I can't give you any insight there. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pros: The camera takes crisp pictures with vivid color and has a fast reaction time even in low light. The small size makes it easy to stick in your pocket. The HD video is amazing. Cons: The video is set to HD out of the box which can use up memory quickly if you are not careful. In HD mode the battery drains very quickly so having an extra one or two on hand is a good idea. Overall: As an advanced amateur photographer I love this camera!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Overall I like the camera. I love the compact size. The color is not what I wanted and still not great in the low light of our house but takes great pictures outside. Still a little slow on shutter speed with my kids they move so fast but comparable to most point and shoot cameras. I have not used the video feature yet.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought the Canon ELPH 300 HS to replace my lost SD 1200 IS. I originally bought the ELPH 100 IS, but there were two things I did not like about it: 1. No zoom while in video mode, and 2. The control buttons are too small I returned the 100 and bought the 300 and am very happy with my decision. Even though the LCD is a little smaller (2.7 vs. 3.0), the camera has larger controls which make it easier to access the abundant features (including a tilt-shift mode called miniature mode), and it can zoom while in video mode. There are also modes for video shooting and is shoots video in HD and stereo. It has a pretty wide angle lens, going down to 21.5 mm and can shoot in Macro mode. One of the things I really like about it is that you can set it to display a grid on the LCD. This is nice ... because it helps level your shots and aids when shooting in thirds (look it up if you are not familiar with this photographic concept). I bought this camera as a compliment to my primary camera, which is Canon 40D DSLR with a variety of lenses. The 300 HIS is great because I like having a camera that fits in my pocket and can take it anywhere I go, which I do. The photo quality is very good, as is the video quality. It seems to take a little time between shots, but it does have a high-speed burst mode for action shots. Another thing that I did notice is that when taking close-up shots with the flash on, it sometimes produces a shadow in the lower-right side of the frame. The kit includes the Canon Digital Solutions software for basic editing and downloading from the camera and USB/RCA cables for connecting to your computer and TV. I wish that the kit also included a mini HDMI cable because it has an HDMI connection. Other than that I have not complaints. It's small, easy to use, and takes great quality, 12mp photo's. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Easy To Use; Nice Body Color; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Large Clear LCD
Cons: Limited Zoom
Great compact size for traveling. Great pictures.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Pros out weight the cons..24MM WIDEANGLE
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom; Small / Compact; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Short Lag Time; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: No Viewfinder
While I havnt had this quite long enough yet, it has VERY slow zoom on video! Also, it has very poor focus on low battery for some reason. It also lacks a wide angle shot and post card like my old sd800, as well as an aquarium and firewroks setting like my old sd800! It also annoyingly can not hold an LCD protector- it keeps coming off when sliding it in/out of case. It is because the LCD isnt recessed and actually sticks out a micron over the rest of the back. VERY POOR DESIGN! It also is extrememly hard to erase a picture that you had just taken as it requires like 4-5 steps! UUGH! The 24mm ultra wide angle ... is superb though and so is the compact size. Not many customizing sound settings either like my old sd800. (No dog howling when on self timer!) I think all in all for 12 mp, it has the same pic quality as my 7 mp sd800, just alot neater. I reccomend it, although they can def improve on it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, resolution, video capability, ease of use and the color is cute!
Cons: Haven't found anything yet!
I have had Sonys for years, but they don't really take good indoor pictures (outstanding for outdoors). So, I decided to find a little camera that was good all the time and not bulky at all (like my Sony). I was originally looking at a less expensive model, but after looking some more, I ended up buying this model (in Red too). I can now say that I am officially in LOVE with the camera. Is small, light, fast, it takes GREAT pictures, the resolution is awesome and is so easy to use. No matter what button I press, it takes good pictures (not like my other camera that I messed up the pics anytime I touched a different setting). I am actually going back to the store t ... oday to purchase one for my Mom. This camera is worth the money! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I carry a point and shoot camera with me on my belt all the time. As the designated photographer for several organizations and groups, I need a camera available to quickly shoot things as they happen. The Powershot 300 is an excellent small camera. It is loaded with features and takes great photos. It has a large LCD and simple to operate controls. As much as I love the features, the biggest draw back for the quick candid photos I take is the length of time the camera takes to focus and shoot. Often those candid moments are missed. My other issue is its delicate construction. With the camera in a belt pouch, bumping into a chair arm put a small dent in the front lens ring. My last point and shoot from another manufacturer lasted more than four years with this kind of use. I'm concerned abo ... ut the life of this light weight construction. Those issues aside, I am pleased with the camera. It has great stability in low light conditions and its auto controls take great flash photos. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I have had the Canon Elph 300 HS camera only for a few days. Pros: + backlit CMOS sensor. Works well in low light. + HD video + Ability to zoom while taking video + Excellent pictures for a point and shoot. I also have a Canon SLR. It does not provide SLR-quality in terms of depth-of-field, but great for the cameras of this size. + Small size + Very wide angle from 24 mm. Provides interesting photo composing opportunities compared to a camera that starts at 30 mm. + My daughter loved a shooting mode in which it captures a small amount of video prior to shooting a photograph to show the activity before the photo. + metal tripod mount + HDMI output + Program mode provides some flexibility in terms of choosing white balance and flash mode.
Cons: - Bo ... dy appears to be a combination of metal+plastic (not sure). It seems sturdy enough, but I wish it was all metal and Canon stated that clearly. - No aperture priority/shutter priority/manual mode.
Competitor camera with similar features to look at: sony DSC-WX9. It appears to be a toss up between the two - both appear outstanding cameras in their class. We ended up going for the Canon Elph 300 HS. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: ease of use
Cons: the strap included
Love this camera! We needed a replacement camera becuase ours was old and starting to lock up. So we purchased this new version of our old camera and absolutely love it! I read the previous reviews on here to make sure others were pleased and if any issues. The camera is perfect! Works wonderful, takes great pics, small enough to fit in pocket or small carry pouch, the texture is an easy to grip- I like that, the features are amazing! Love it! VERY PLEASED! And the battery charger came with it- yeah! We did purchase extra batteries at Amazon for a lower price and have been very pleased, we were able to buy mutli batteries for a very low price. The only thing I do not like about the camer accessories- the strap that came with it is ve ... ry stiff and always sticks in the camera shot, so I replaced it for one I had on my old camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I love the very small size of this camera, and the quality of pictures it takes. It's a great point and shoot camera to just keep in my purse at all times. The video quality is good, also. I had previously owned cameras that used AA rechargeable batteries, so I was concerned with the battery life of this camera, but I have been very impressed. The battery lasts much longer than AA's. I'm very pleased with the quality of the camera for the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Small and OK for the money.
Item.Review:
Pros: Size fits into pocket
Cons: SLight distortion at edges and pictures need color corx. They are a little on the green side.
I wanted a small camera to fit into pocket. Display is very good, and pictures are Ok. I have noticed a slight distortion on edges of lens and when I bring them over to my computer they generally need a color correction. They are on the green side of neutral.
Flash is not great.
I like the one touch button to take a movie and the fact that I can zoom in while taking it.
I own other canons and like the software.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Video
Cons: Durability
I bought this camera in June 2011. The pictures were good, though not as great as I had hoped. They were only somewhat better than those I had taken with a Sony Cybershot purchased in 2003. The HD video, however, was excellent and quickly became a favorite feature. Unfortunately, the camera refused to open when I turned it on in September. I sent it back to Canon and they replaced it. I paid shipping. I had a new camera in a week. The camera they sent me, however, was defective. The shutter would not consistently open all the way or close completely. I needed to send it back again. They paid shipping this time, and replaced it once more. Another week without a camera. In January, I noticed a spot had developed on the lens that showed up on any pho ... to I took with telephoto. Very frustrating. I didn't address it immediately with Canon, however, having already been frustrated with my experiences with the camera. Then last week I took the camera to the park--I placed it in my front pants pocket as I've always done, and when I took it out, the top of the camera had split open and one of the tabs that held the camera together was sticking out. I sent the camera back to Canon. They considered this damage to the camera and refused to fix it without charging me $140. Now, nine months into this camera, I'm left with virtually nothing--I'm not going to invest anymore money into the camera because of its durability issues. My Sony lasted eight years--the main reason I wanted to upgrade was the advances in technology. I didn't treat this camera any differently than I treated the Sony. My recommendation is to stay away from this Canon Powershot Elph 300 HS--it's a durability nightmare. Four major concerns in nine months, and now, no Canon support. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: EVERYTHING!!!!!
Cons: e-manual/guide book (no printed version included).
I'm going to be honest. I've been a little dissatisfied with Canon cameras lately (but I'll admit that part of it was my own fault in how I cared for my cameras). The part that wasn't my fault was the shutter response time. It was so slow in the point and shoot consumer-product models. HOWEVER, this model got it right! It's immediate (when using the shutter button halfway focus trick)!
I am sooooooo happy with this purchase. I tried another brand (Nikon) since I've been disappointed with Canon, and within days of using the Nikon I absolutely hated it. I really wanted to give them a try, but they didn't even come close to the quality and vibrance that Canon always gives my images. And THIS pa ... rticular Canon model absolutely floored me! It takes the most gorgeous pictures!
The quality of the images (even in low-light situations) are impressive, and the video is amazing too!
Features: lots of them. Like "high speed burst" which is really high-speed burst (unlike "continuous shooting" in their older models), and then there's "miniature effect", "accent" (splash of color effect), and much more. Then there's the typical things like sepia, b&w, etc..., and of course "scenes" like beach, snow, foilage, etc!
I highly recommend this camera! Even my friend who is a professional photographer is impressed with it. She's going to buy herself one (for personal-use of course, not for professional-use).
The downsides are few: -- 1. It might take a bit of getting used to to access the various features and settings. But the electronic manual offers much help in showing you how to access the features and sub-features. The only problem is... -- 2) it's an e-manual so you have to lug around your laptop or e-reader to get help while your out taking pics! lol -- 3) You'll probably get better looking shots without using "auto", but that's typical of all cameras. -- 4) Battery doesn't seem to last as long as the NB-6L, but it still has long battery-life. It lasted me about 3-4 days befor ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: after ending up with lots of vacation shots from a smartphone camera, i decided i should invest in a decent camera to have better pictures. i'm not a photographer at all (i know the 'rule of thirds' but that's basically it); i just wanted something around $200 that was small, had a rechargeable battery, and took great pictures with little hassle. i started with reviews on cnet and immediately had my choices down to the 300hs and the sony dsc-wx9. i lamented for awhile b/w the sony and canon but ultimately decided to go with canon. even though the sony had 16mp (as opposed to 12), a carl zeiss lens, and a larger screen, i felt more comfortable going with canon since photography is all they do. i'm happy with this purchase. the pictures are great and the battery lasts forever. its even abl ... e to take shots with some nice depth of field (foreground focused, background blurry) by using focus select or the portrait setting. i would definitely recommend this small, feature-packed camera to anyone looking for a simple and powerful point-and-shoot. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Cost
I snagged this when it was $147 on line and they matched it in store. Its a great camera and takes awesome pictures, I mainly use it to upload short HD movies to youtube. It films in 1080 HD and the picture is almost like a DSLR camera. I can't believe how crisp it is for this price. The battery is also awesome, for taking pictures and short video clips you could possibly get through a whole day with one charge easily. I got the camera in black and I like the granite look and feel The camera seems sturdy though the battery hinge seems like it could be tiger. Don't hesitate to purchase this camera, it is one of the best point and shoots out there!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I hadn`t bought a camera for several years and needed one that offered a high resolution and other useful functions. This camera is user friendly, fairly easy to figure out, and takes great images. You can edit images right on the camera itself as well as tweaking them later using the software that comes with it. You do have to buy a memory card (they don`t tell you that in the description), and it`s a good idea to buy a case for it - not a big deal. Overall, this camera is very good for the money and I have gotten great results from each shot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a Must have camera, as long as you are an amateur. Why I say this? All pro and semi-pro photographers will have it only as a back up to a DSLR. Also we never use cameras with AUTO mode (best way is to experiment manual mode, even if takes 2-3 months to learn how to set it in 30seconds for perfect picture. For an amateur all pics are great, for a pro one pic from other 50 pics is good...this is a common because you never make the perfect picture every time you press the button. At this camera use the kids and pets mode if you have to make fast pics. Also if the light is good, you can make burst photo to be sure you have one good. Never try burst in low light, does not work good and is normal. Try to get close to ISO 100, will have no noise, but also need light...the worst case, s ... et to ISO 400 in low light, but must have a very steady hand even with stabilizer on. A ISO over 400 will make grainy pics, but is normal as long as we talk about PS camera, and not DSLR. The battery is not a good choice, I would prefer standard AA bat., but if you recharge it every day before exit from house, will be OK. Also get an auto charger, will help.(spare batt will be great) The optics deliver a good image in wide mode, but you need to make a very small geometry adjustment (for amateur is ok, for semi pro will need to use any Photoshop,Photoscape or other photo editor). The zoom is only 5x optic (we will not talk about digital zoom that is only a commercial thing), but will be enough for photos. If you want bigger zoom, look for a big camera, not for pocket ones, because the lens are better. I personally use a Fuji S6500FD for big zoom, and 6MP are more than enough. As conclusion: - is a very good PS camera for amateurs, also a good backup for semi pro users. - use AUTO in good light with no heavy contrasts. In rest go to Program AE. - consider an auto charger or spare batt. - use FULL HD video only if have a FULL HD TV. In rest go with smaller res., will be enough. Comparation with NIKON and SONY from same class : Positive: - better colours than N and S. - good burst - CMOS sensor = more sensitive Negative: - Nikon faster in shutter, also ISO 80 - Sony better at handling high contrast pics (Canon is very good but not AUTO, PROGRAM AE only) Hope this helped you in decisions. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Very small
Cons: Picture and Video quality
I really tried to love this camera; wanted to be able to rave about a Canon product. However, I must have gotten a defective version of the Elph300. I took a ton of pictures in all sorts of conditions and the results were pretty awful. As others have said, the pictures are soft and very lacking in sharp detail. Also, there are definate flaws in how the images display bright reflections (white highlights). Low light images are not bad but the colors here are also off. Seems like the quality of the lens is poor since the wide angle causes a fair amount of distortion. Regarding the video, this was also a huge disappointment. While fairly sharp, there is skipping or what may be judder when I pan the camera quickly. It is annoying e ... nough to make the video unusable. Again, maybe I got a defective version of this camera but I'll be going back to a camera with a Carl Zeiss lens. Thanks but no thanks Canon! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, decent price (on sale), Easy to use.
Cons: poor photo quality in low light conditions, no internal memory, flash hit or miss, trouble focusing, black finish mater.
After a long time looking for a digital camera that would outdo the lesser MP camera on my iPhone 4. Well, I was way off with this Canon 300. The picture quality is very poor to say the least, especially in low light conditions. The automatic flash is hit or miss even when it IS needed! To keep it short, I will be returning this camera asap and going for the 310 which was said to be better in low light conditions, i just hope I'm not as disappointed as I was with this one. On a good note (video quality is much better than my iPhone, but you buy a digital camera for...PICTURES)

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Finally A Camera that I Love
Item.Review:
I got this camera a couple weeks ago before my trip to California and Vegas. This was a replacement for me Coolpix S9100 and the several other cameras I've owned over the last 2-3 years. This is by far my favorite. It's easy to get great pictures out of this camera. The size and feel of the camera is great. Canon is finally putting high speed burst and continuous shot into their mid range pocket cams which is great for me because I take pictures of a lot of sports. The hd videos look great also.
This camera does not pack a ton of features, but it has more than enough. Also, the features beyond the basics are not super easy to get to quickly (but they really don't need to be as the auto mode is very good). I've really been through a good number of cameras and a couple have been highe ... r end cameras. This really is my favorite. I just saw that today the price is $129. THIS IS A GREAT DEAL FOR THIS CAMERA! I paid $50 more and I have no regrets. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact.
Cons: over exposure of pictures.
I own three Digital ELPHs and this one I am not impress with.
Pros: Compact and easily fits in a pocket. Fast 3 fps. and 12MP. Fast start up for instant picture taking. So far battery lasts a long time. Good average zoom, and easy access to playback mode.
Cons: over exposure on auto. Always have to program the ISO to compensate. Not a problem if you know what to do but its a hassle sometimes. Small width prevents the camera to stay upright on uneven surfaces for timer pictures. Flash seems to dominate the picture.
Overall an average point and shoot camera, and I will still use it for everyday activities.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Video
Cons: Lack of manual functions
I purchased this for still images, but can't stop using the video. I also have a Kodak Playsport and the Canon has much better video. Would prefer the video button to be placed in a different spot, since it is difficult to stop the video without causing camera movement. Still camera is great. Would love to be able to have just a few more manual controls such as shutter or aperture priority. Great camera for the price. Takes awesome pictures of people. It handles difficult lighting situations with ease.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Does the job, does it well.
Item.Review: This is great for just keeping in your pocket or backpack, it's way small, but delivers great pictures. When zoomed out it's surprisingly wide, but it doesn't zoom in as much as I would like. The black version I have has an awesome sand-paper like texture that makes it easy to hold and handle. The case is all metal, which is good cause I'm usually pretty tough on my equipment. It does lack real manual controls. Has some pre-set stuff, which is ok I guess. But for just full auto point and shoot it's great. I'm also really pleased with the video function, makes great HD video. For the money, it was a great buy.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Good Image Quality; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Small / Compact
I love canon D cam. Its image quality is really good.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this unit to replace a Casio point/shoot that I had for several years. I wanted a smaller body and faster start-up and larger screen, and at the same time, retain all the great functions of the old Casio. I shopped for a long time. This Canon is everything I wanted and more. I would highly recommend it. The picture quality is wonderful. (I only shoot large images.) But, as a somewhat pro-photographer, I thought I would really like the ultra-wide angle lens (24mm). But I don't. I find that I like to start composing a shot with a more reasonable 28mm. 99% of the users of this camera will never know. (Why not start with 24 and zoom into 28? Well, that diverts my concentration away from composing, and adds a little extra time to the task.) Now, for indoor shots, 24mm is not a bad sta ... rting point, but it's just a personal thing with me that I like 28mm. Plus,on some pics you will experience some optical distortion at 24mm. And the only other con would be the placement of the flash. It's very easy to cover the flash with your finger, something that has to be learned, but I normally use available light anyway. I don't shoot much video but the one-button for it is very nice. Would I buy it again? you bet - but with a 28mm lens, I think the model 200 has it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought this camera for my parents, who aren't too tech savvy. They can keep the camera on Auto mode and photos are great. Having a dedicated button for video is also great because my parents would get confused with having to go through the menu system, and you could lose precious seconds of video. The sand-paper like grip is great. It stays put in a simple camera sleeve-type case, although I could see the interior of the case possibly wearing over time. I wish the manual would state what memory card speeds the camera can support. Since I didn't know how fast it could support, I got a Class 10, 200x memory card which is capable of up to 30MB/sec transfer. It seems very fast. Doesn't come with a book manual, just one on a CD (which I haven't viewed yet). The camera has been that int ... uitive for me where I could perform most functions without looking up the manual. The only function I may have to look up is the multi-shot function where it'll take consecutive shots very quickly. Overall, I think this is the best small point and shoot available below $200. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: We've used several Canon point-n-shoot cameras over the last several years and they continue to impress. What we weren't expecting with this one was some of the more fun shooting modes, like super slow-motion video and high-speed burst. Our kids do a lot of sports activities, and we've had too much fun playing with these. Think cannonballs in the swimming pool in super-slo mo ;-) We used the high-speed burst for the last triathlon the kids did, showing them crossing the finish line one frame at a time - very cool. Pictures are crisp, auto-focus is fast and accurate, the camera itself feels sturdy even in such a small package. Would definitely recommend.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera to replace my Casio Exilim (not sure which model) but I've owned three of them. I didn't like my latest model Exilim as much as the other two (it always seemed to be a lemon and finally broke) and decided this ELPH camera received so many accolades I would automatically love it! Unfortunately this was not so. The first day I started playing with the camera, I noticed a very slow shutter lag. I have a 17 month old and I was missing every action shot (this never happened with my Exilim). I contacted B&H Support via chat and they were wonderful at helping me understand which settings may decrease my shutter lag. Turns out shutting off the red-eye and flash did the trick. (I must say the pic without flash does come out very nice compared to no flash on my Exilim ... .) However, I find it extremely inconvenient, especially at spontaneous moments to find the right adjustment for that particular shot. For a small P&S camera, I want it to be fast and easy. This camera just didn't meet those requirements. I thought the quality of the photos may compensate for this frustration, but upon downloading my pics, I can't even notice the difference. I am a recreational/novice user, so maybe I just can't appreciate the features this camera offers? I gave it one week to see if I'd get used to the features, and I'm now trading it in for another Exilim. I tried to love you ELPH! Oh, the last straw was when the battery charge died...I never received any notifications or alerts...it just stopped after a day or two of use. I used to barely charge my Exilim, so I was pretty shocked at the battery life. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: First of all, I want to say that I bought this camera the day after I had bought AND returned the Sony cybershot dsc-wx9. I am %100 more satisfied with the canon than I was with the sony. DON'T buy the sony!! lol I use this camera to take pictures of my kids indoors/outdoors, scenery, travel, family photos. I am VERY happy with this little thing. I kinda like the rough texture; makes it easier to grip. Great in low light and the flash isn't overpowering when used (but I hardly use the flash.) The color is the best thing IMO. Very accurate colors and you can adjust the color settings to several preset options ranging from neutral to vivid (and some other funky, cool effects.) The image stabilizer is awesome. White balance is pretty accurate, too. All around, this camera is AWESOME!! I gues ... s if I must complain about something, it would be it doesn't have an option for Tv. I wish I could make the shutter speed faster to catch my active toddler without having to use the flash. But I guess I'd have to get a DSLR for that :) ALSO: I don't use this camera for video so the battery is actually pretty good for just pictures expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Video + Wide Angle for the Price
Item.Review: To summarize: - HD video quality very good for the price; you need to spend $500 more to get better video quality - The wide angle is AWESOME. I underestimated how great this was when I bought it. - Photo quality was good, but not as sharp as I would have hoped. This camera is extremely versatile. I know of no other camera with such good quality in this small size. Where else can you get a HD video camera with wide angle lens that fits in your pocket? That said, you do get what you pay for. I found myself using the video function more than than the camera function, simply because I was somewhat disappointed in the camera function. Once I downloaded the photos they seemed rather flat and not as sharp as I would have expected from Canon. I had used a previous generation of an S3 abo ... ut 4 years ago and expected this camera to perform as well as that; it didn't. Bottom line: Don't expect amazing photographs from this camera, but if you're looking for a tiny pocket camera for great videos and functionality this is a good one. Final note: If using for video I highly recommend using a small Joby Gorillapod (tripod), it helped me greatly. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Features, Small,Portable,
Cons: the delete inbox is a bit hard to figure out at first.
First of all this is my first point and shoot camera, and though I'm more of a DSLR man but all I have to say about this camera is WOW.
First of all I've never had any problems with Canon's simple and easy to use button layout. If you're one of those people that like a fast and easy camera to use get this camera.
The Features on this camera is simple and amazing. There's the auto shot and program shot. The program shot comes with all the effects like the tilt shift,toy camera, etc. Absolute fun camera to use.
The picture quality is pretty nice. There's nothing wrong with it. It's a point a shoot camera and not a DSLR so... why really bother for the quality. It's t ... he amazing moments that you want on this camera if you're main camera is not on you.
The value price for this camera isn't bad. I say its well worth the money. Also the reason why the black is slightly pricey is because the material of the camera feels solid. It's not smooth like most camera surfaces but has a rough kind of feel to it..sort of like very fine sandpaper. Though it doesn't feel its going to slip out of your hand, it just feels right and you know its in your hands. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Wanted a small Camera that took decent quality pictures, and after much research, I chose the Canon Elph 300 HS. Very happy with my purchase. Even though I have big hands, this Camera doesn't feel that small in my hands, and the texture coating gives it a really nice feel. Takes nice pictures, the 5X Optical Zoom is amazing for a Camera this small, and I really like the dedicated movie button. I wish it had a larger LCD Screen and an Optical Viewfinder for those really Sunny days, but other than that, for the money, this is a very nice Camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: While I like a camera with interchangeable lens capabilities, the smaller camera is always the one I end us taking around and using because I can put it in my pocket. I love the small size of this camera and the wide angle lens feature. I has a lot of features and settings for a small camera and the small plug in battery charger is very convenient. It is the third Elph I've owned and I loved them all. This one will probably be my favorite. It is a little slow setting up between pictures but I can live with that. I also miss a viewfinder because it isn't always easy to see the display in bright sunlight.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small and simple to use. Auto and preset modes work fairly well.
If you want to take slightly better pictures you can change most of the settings manually, but the menus can take a while to navigate.
Video recording quality is satisfactory.
Cons: Makes an annoying high pitched noise.
The audio recording quality isn't great, but that shouldn't be a surprise for a point and shoot camera.
Lots of unnecessary features, like color swap, but they're easy to ignore.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Can't say enough GOOD things about
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, camera body quality strong feel, NIGHT shots and movie ability, controls
Cons: Honestly nothing noted so far after 1 week vacation constant use.
Bought this camera as a replacement for Canon SD850 I have been using for several years. The 850 still performing great and now in hands of good friends, just wanted to treat myself to a new one.
Was hesitant to make purchase of a relatively new product without reviews at the time. I have come to rely heavily on these reviews and was concerned. I also worried that as a guy who is 6'2" and 213 lbs that camera would be way to small to handle as much thinner and smaller than already small 850. Turned out that this camera feels more comfortable in hand because of the slightly rough surface. I found this to b ... e a plus over smooth surface since I feel I have a decent grip for a change. Of course I always still use wrist strap at all times just in case. One would be remiss not doing so with the small camera's of today.
The steel body also makes me feel confidant handling the camera body. Though small camera simply has feel of a solid well made piece of equipment. I am very happy and comfortable handling and even putting it in pants pocket uncased, though I do usually use a small case.
Pictures, most digital take good to great outdoor photo's, it is indoor and night that they really don't usually standup to the old film cameras. Well I haven't taken a lot of indoor low light yet but I did take NIGHT HANDHELD mode shots from a moving platform including movies. his on recent cruise coming back into Port Everglades Florida. Normal all I have ever gotten is a blurry mass of light. AMAZING I have night pictures and movies, and decent ones! I am so impressed I did a quick youtube presentation of some shots and movies, just 2 and a half minutes worth a peek. Remember even looking good there they lose some making movie to upload. On my screens WOW! Yes I rested camera on balcony rail most time but remember this is nighttime moving ship and some of objects are moving as well.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jx7ddzaBckg
Battery life is also extremely good just as it was with the 8 ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: A standard point-and-shoot that is easy to use, with fast and accurate auto-focus. A big pro - the one click movie recording making it easy to record movies without struggling through various menu options. I did have some issues with Image Stabilization, especially in low lighting.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Sharp photos the super simple way.
Item.Review: After much research I decided to go with this little Canon point and shoot to take along on our motorcycle vacation to the Four Corners region. I must say that it has been more than adequate for the task. It fits easily into the tightest of pockets and takes up very little room, a most important consideration when traveling by motorcycle. I have been keeping it in one of the little tank pouches that Harley makes to replace the stock bib on most of their softail models. You can put it in a small padded case and it fits in there perfectly???comes out quickly too. Something else I have found is that this little camera really fires up in a hurry. Push the on/off button and you are ready to take photos in way under two seconds???incredible! And the extra wide angle of the 24mm (35mm equivalent ... ) zoom lets you really get it all in while shooting those fantastic vistas you see out West. The super simple Auto mode lets you start taking photos in seconds. Even the most incredibly uneducated will be zooming and snapping first class photos in minutes. And I do mean first class. The photos this little camera takes are truly some of the sharpest and clearest I have seen from any point and shoot. Though the pictures are not the same quality as a high end DSLR, they are really much more than I ever expected. The only complaint I have is that the rather small view screen is difficult to see in bright sunlight. I would venture to say that this is true of all but the most expensive point and shoot cameras. In conclusion all I can say is I'm going to keep this little gem of a camera and I feel like I got more than my moneys worth from this one. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
This is quick to turn on, and the image stabalization is fantastic. The battery life is outstanding and you can recharge it instead of going through a ton of AA batteries like most other cameras. The features are strong and the picture and video quality is great. Fantastic product for the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, Price
Cons: Video Zoom Recording
I purchased this camera because of its compact size. I can put it in my pants pocket with no problem. It's very portable. It takes pretty good pictures. Video quality is good. The only thing I don't like is that the sound cuts out somewhat while zooming in and out. It's able to take pictures in low light, but many of them come out blurry. The burst mode allows you to take rapid shots, and I like how they are lumped together in playback mode.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon Point and Shoots are the Best!
Item.Review:
Pros: Great pictures, great price
I've had several different P&S cameras over the years and Canon have always been the best. The picture quality is the best you'll find in a non-DSLR camera. It's ultra compact and easy to use. The new video record button is extra handy.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small size, great video, better than average pictures
Cons: pictures are slow compared to SLR cameras, better than some point-n-shoot
I would definitely buy this camera again. I did not believe that I wanted a camera this small. I was wrong. Great to carry in your pocket and have available whenever you need. Better than average pictures. Full 1080 HD video -- looks great on TV direct from the camera. Only complaints are minor -- pictures are a bit soft in low light and camera takes some time to auto focus and shoot. These minor complaints are more than made up by the excellent video quality.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture Quality
Cons: Not enough features
I bought this camera to replace my 8-yr old Z700 Kodak Easyshare that finally went out on me. W/ my $10-rewards certificate, I got this(case, 4G SD card + $15-gift card) bundle taxes and all for $132-ish. The biggest complaint I have is that the video quality in low light to dark setting, is very poor. (Audio wasn't all that great either.)The pictures however, were great even in a very dark room,esp. for someone known to be the worst "picture taker ever". I recorded my son's event where the entire room was pretty much just candle-lit and I could barely see anything when I played it back. So, I don't know if there is a "lighting option" for recording vids in low light or what, but I obviously didn't find or figure it out. Another ... thing is, it doesn't have as many "fun" picture editing tools as my old Kodak, ie, cartoon, fisheye, drawing, etc....But I can live with that. Nice sleek design, easy enough to use, great pics and unbeatable price! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Worst piece of junk I ever purchase! Do not buy it
Item.Review:
Pros: very slim
Cons: Only when taking picture and videos. The flash worked nice at least
I purchased this camera at BestBuy last week for $129(brand new) but the pic quality were so bad that when I compared them with to my old Casio 5Meg Pix that is 6yrs old they look unacceptable. The colors, the sharpness and the focus were below acceptable. Videos were horrible and when I play them, on any of my home computers the screen kept showing every 2 seconds a bunch of horrible, staticky lines across the length of all the videos screen. I formatted the memory card hoping that this could be the issue but the problem came back the next day. I returned it back to BestBuy and I got my money with no hassle after going through so much BS with this Canon ELPH 300 HS. It is ... the worst junk made by any Camera manufacturer and it was NEW. I always hear about the good quality with Canon cameras but I had 3 of them and 2 of them gave me nothing but problems(Btw my old Casio 5.0 Megs that is 6 yrs old, keeps on going strong. Shame on these people, I'll never get another Canon. Ever!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price and excellent pics
Cons: Should come with a memory card but doesn't
This is a great camera. It's small & light. Took it on vacation & everyone thought my pictures looked amazing. Love the fact that the battery is rechargeable & I don't have to run out and buy AA batteries. It is annoying that the memory card isn't included but thankfully they're not expensive.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, fast focus, just point and click
Cons: Strap not the best
Bought this as a replacement for an older Canon. Small, easy to carry and easy to use. Fits in a pocket or purse easily. Battery life good. Good quality pictures. Effective flash.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Slow motion is not as clear if you are not up close
I LOVE this little camera. It fits in my small purse, takes great photos and has great features. This camera replaced my Canon Point and Shoot 1400SD and that was already a good camera.
There is a new feature called slow motion that records video in...you guessed it; slow motion. It also has a burst mode to take a ton of pictures at once. The Toy picture feature is cute too. I am a photographer and have a Canon EOS 60D, but don't always want to carry it everywhere I go, so to not miss out, I carry this one everywhere and haven't disappointed yet.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything, Small, Price, Easy to Use
Cons: Slow Auto Focus and Could have a Longer Battery Life
I bought this camera to upgrade from my old Canon Power Shot A630. I needed something that was smaller and took high def pics and vids. This one was it. I watched YouTube video reviews on it before i bought it. Everyone had nothing but good stuff to say about it. Its easy to use and functions very well. The video is in 1080p. as well as the pictures it takes are high def as well. Its a great camera. I love it.
Only down side is, the auto focus is slow. So depending on how fare you are looking and then quickly switch to up close or want to look at something really up close, it can take like 3 to 4 seconds before it focuses in. But who cares. Its not really that bad, an ... d for the cheap price and all the Amazing features you get, I think you just like me can deal with that. Can't win them all.
Its a great camera and if you buy this camera You will be very proud and not disappointed. It could even make great gift for some one. You wont be disappointed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great little pocket camera from Canon. I've been very pleased with the performance of this camera. It's got a decent size sensor, picture quality is quite good, zoom is reasonable, and it's got a really nice rear display. It's important to recognize what this isn't. You will not get DSLR (or even G1X/G12) performance from a camera like this. The flash is okay, there is a bit of shutter lag, battery life is okay, etc. It's a pocket camera. For me though, the synergy of small size, simplicity and great picture quality makes this an easy choice for anyone wanting to have a camera with them at all times that exceeds the capabilities of a smartphone camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: small, good image quality
Cons: purple fringing in high contrast areas
This camera has an awesome high-speed-slow motion feature hidden in the settings. The image quality is awesome - with the exception of pretty heave purple fringing in high contrast areas.
