Of course, it is a small sensor camera, this is to be expected. The camera is so light and small that I carry it with me all the time, so no shot is missed. These small cameras have come a long way. Short of getting a real camera like a DSLR or Rangefinder, this is probably as good as it gets. Careful with the lens cover. It looks a little fragile. No problems so far.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, ease of use.
Cons: Zoomed pix
My zoomed distance shots are blurry, out of focus. There is also a delay between shots. Pictures do not have the clarity I would expect from this caliber of camera. It was worth the sale price that included SD card and case.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice step up from the SD1400!
Item.Review: Once upon a time I traveled the world with a Canon SD1000. It was a wonderful little cam that finally got taken from me at an event where I was performing (who robs the DJ? WTH?).Nevertheless, I took the plunge on the SD1400 and was VEry disappointed. Grainy in low light, horrible pics and quality (that cold digital look), weak warm up time, and SLOW when taking that perfect shot. The 300 came out not too long ago and its killer. Only [$], great in low light, decent burst (though you have to settle for 3MP shots), beautiful video quality, 24mm lens, stereo sound, and FAST on the trigger. Thanks to this bad boy I don't miss shots I want to get when out with friends. My SD1400 bit it from all the agressive travel to South America and desert festivals, etc. Finally the screen cracked ... among many problems. To be fair, I put it thru heck, even sleeping on it while it lay in my pockets while I trekked the Andes. Still, I was never happy with it.This camera has been wonderful so far. It will soon get some small tests as I take it to Europe. Let's hope it holds up like my SD1000 did! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I had a Powershot 780 IS from a few years ago and this camera (Powershot 300 HS) takes clearly better pictures, even though the pixel count is the same and the zoom range and lens size are similar. Focusing is also noticeably faster, though still much slower than a DSLR. Colors are more vibrant and the images are much sharper. Settings like toy camera and miniature are fun. The auto setting is a bit quirky and unpredictable in terms of speed/aperture choices as well as flash on/off choice and autofocus, but that is pretty much par for the course on pocket cameras such as this. I think Canon is still the leader in the point-and-shoot market and I am very happy with this as a back-up/snapshot camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a fantastic camera... Very small and loaded with features! Takes great HD video, and wonderful pictures. Extremely small. Exact size size as a credit card (tall and wide), and about as thick as 13 to 14 of them stacked (yes, I made a stack of credit cards and compared it to the camera). Only thing is that low-light pictures are a little grainy. Also, it has an auto-sensing flash that does not always turn on in low-light situations. I cannot find a way to force the flash to work like with most cameras, which is frusterating. If I could manually control of the flash I would have given this 5 stars.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Fun, compact camera- great video too
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Black textured surface; Easy Closeup Mode; Easy Auto Modes; Easy To Use; Great video
Cons: Weak Flash; Lag / Shutter Delay
I bought this camera for my wife but I use it more than she does. I bought it an easy to carry camera as I normally use a Canon 7d and 60d so I wasn't going to buy a larger P&S camera. Now I find it's my 'go to' camera for HD video as it's so easy. dSLRs shoot great video but they're not that easy to use as they don't autofocus and have limited depth of field. I also use it for macro shots as P&S cameras have that capability built-in and this one automatically can go into the mode. I would have purchased the red version but it doesn't have the texture that the black one does and is harder to grip (I have big hands). Ev ... eryone should use the wrist strap anyway! The flash is a little weak and 'shot to shot' delay can be frustrating but in general it's a fun little camera (remember, I'm used to dSLR cameras!) The included video is shot with both the little 300HS and my 7d- a little hard to tell the difference! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a camera that was small to throw in my purse but did a lot of the functions of my bigger camera... this does it. I have the Canon SX30IS for sight-seeing and big events. The Powershot 300 does a lot of the same things my bigger camera does. The primary difference: less optical zoom. But, the two menus are pretty much the same with just minor differences. And, it has a majority of the same shooting options in terms of color, light, scenes, etc. It makes switching from one camera to the next a breeze. Shots are very clear and camera is lightweight and easy to use. Perfect for those impromptu events with friends and family.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Amazing price on a good camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact
This is a great snapshot camera. Like all cameras in its class it works best outdoors or any situation with lots of light. Canon's point and shoot line are great and have good image quality compared to other P&S cameras. it is not a DSLR by any means, but I would recommend this to anyone who wants to have a decent camera around for family shots. macro feature is nice too.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great video/photos on tiny point & shoot
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Short Lag Time; Good Image Quality; Great Zoom; Easy To Use; Small / Compact
Amazing video quality on such a small camera. On video playback however, if there was zooming in or out while recording, you can hear it and is a little annoying.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: great quality at a great price
Cons: depending on how you hold the camera you make have a shadow at the bottom from your finger
This is my 3rd "point and Shoot" camera In a span of 7 years. I wanted to upgrade my sanyo because it no longer worked when I really needed it to work. So I researched a while and was looking for a camera that would do a good job at shooting videos. I am a novice youtube video maker and I wanted something that would take nice quality pictures as well as videos. The sound pics up nice and the pictures look amazing. I also enjoy the the features on this camera. There are so many different features such as slow motion videos down to focus and making some parts blurry. So anywho I do not know the photography terms just yet but I have really been ... enjoying this camera. I picked up back in Nov. and I use it about 1-2 times a week. Battery works really well!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great video and images, very easy to use, a video camera in your pocket
I was sick of lugging around my SLR and wanted something that would be less of a burden, but would still take great pictures. This camera fit the bill...and then some. It takes lovely pictures, even indoors, with the added bonus of HD video. Now I get video that I never would have captured before for family memories. Its also very easy to use, with clear and simple controls. I even bought one for my dad, who is 88, and he is also loving it. He kept in in his shirt pocket on a recent trip and used it all the time. One small detail, I found the edge of the lens cover a bit sharp on the red model I first received, and so exchanged it for a black one.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon Elph again best of the best
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my girlfriend who is not a tech-head at all. I wanted something very small (like my aged Canon SD 200) that would take great pictures in automatic mode, and would be easy to access other features. The output of this camera is amazing. It's very small to carry around and is a breeze to use, especially when traveling and one doesn't want to be encumbered by a bulky camera and lenses. Battery life is much better than my old SD 200. This product surpasses all my expectations, and I highly recommend it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Happy with it, would reccomend it
Item.Review: I bought this because my Canon IXUS 800 IS started to die. (This model IXUS is the European model equivalent to the PowerShot SD700 IS and it was spectacular but picture quality and battery time started to go downhill fast after the lens would no longer close all the way after retracting??? this is apparently a common issue with canon's but I still like the brand). I like that the 300 HS camera is small and light, uses the same battery as my IXUS does (you can't beat the convenience of already having an extra battery). I think it is snazzy that the 'zoom' feature works while recording video. So far, I've had a few blurry shots, but many excellent pictures. I like that when in 'auto' mode, the camera truly adjusts automatically changing to different modes when detecting the lighting and di ... stance conditions of your target, but this is a double-edged sword. The auto detection doesn't always pick the best mode resulting in some blurry pictures and missed opportunities for capturing the moment. I'll need to play around with the 300 HS a bit more so that I become more comfortable and efficient at changing modes to get the best shot. Overall I'm quite happy with this camera and feel it is superior to the other cameras in this price range, but I'd be lying if I didn't say I still miss how great my IXUS 800 IS was in its heyday. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I initially wanted S95, then S100, but for my intended use, I could not justify the cost. I also looked at 510 HS, 310 HS, SX 230 and 100 HS as well as Nikon P300, S9100, and S8200. I wanted something that I can set on auto and get great pictures, no matter who presses the shutter. Pros: posh, well-built with metal clad parts; has newer CMOS sensor supposedly better in low light; wide angle starts at very useful 24mm, not 28mm like above-mentioned units; excellent 1080HD video recording with zoom capability during recording; fast start up and minimal lag between shutters (for a P&S); excellent overall photo images with useful low light results; very small body but with manageable buttons; PRICE!! Cons: low-resolution LCD screen compared to competition, and not much else. 100 HS i ... s also very good if you don't mind not being able to zoom during video recording - save $30-40 over 300 HS and zoom starts at 28mm, otherwise same great images. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use.
Cons: Nothing.
Santa delivered as promised. Takes great pictures, instructions are easy to understand. I had the camera up and running for Christmas in less than 10 minutes. Camera came with all kinds of extras, case, extra battery, 4 GB Scandisk.
Made a Christmas video on this camera and burned it on a disk at the end of the day, easy to carry in your pocket or case attached to your belt.
Passed the camera around to let others take pictures of what they liked, great looking pictures, not one bad photo in the batch.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Small / Compact; Short Lag Time; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color; Easy To Use; Large Clear LCD
Easy to use small and compact. Great video capabilities with the wide angle lens. For the money you can't go wrong with this camera. No,it's not a pro camera with all the whistles and bells, it is that little fun camera you put on your pocket and go. For the most part I leave the camera on auto and let it do its job and it works, of course you have to understand the basics of lighting and composition. Don't expect the camera to do miracles for you. Enjoy it and have fun

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I just bought this camera 2 weeks ago, and have been taking constant pictures with it ever since I got it! I love this camera. It has a vast array of features, which are easy to get to in the function menu, and is very user friendly. I really enjoy the 24mm wide angle lense, as it gives more depth and life to pictures. I've owned alot of Canon Elph Powershot cameras over the years, and in my opinion, this is the best one, overall, that I've owned. I am very satisfied with this camera, and would definately recommend it to a friend.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Good Image Quality; Good Image Stabilization; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Great Zoom
Bought this for may wife to carry in her purse. Great portable camera for the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this for two purposes: 1) For digi-scoping and digi-binning wildlife, with an emphasis on birds. It serves this function very well without the need for an adapter. 2) Macro shots of insects and vegetation. I have used (and continue to use) it for the first function with several different brands of telescope and binocular including Swarowski (scopes, older and newer models), Leica (binoculars and scopes), Vortex (scopes), Nikon (binoculars, multiple models), and older Bushnell Spacemaster Scopes. It has a reasonably fast and accurate auto-focus when using it this way, and the multiple-shot drive is fast (noticeably faster than some previous Powershot models that I've used). The video is EXCELLENT, and may be the best facet of this camera. In good light, it is also a very good cam ... era for Macro shots, but if you're forced to use the flash because of a low light situation you will be sacrificing some image quality if you're trying to photograph things within about a foot. Beyond one foot it's okay and doesn't lead to any noticeable image degradation. The autofocus can also have a tough time grabbing onto smaller objects within the field of view, especially small insects against variable-depth backgrounds. When this happens you can remedy this by pre-focusing on something solid at the desired distance (i.e. the back of your hand, or a wall), and then taking the photo of your desired subject. Overall it is a fantastic multi-use camera for these purposes (ESPECIALLY the video and in concert with high-power optics), and of course does just fine with people photos (as always, given enough light). Of course the Canon interface is very user-friendly, and the taking of video is now even easier if you need to video quickly because you don't have to switch modes. You can video by just pressing record at any time. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a semi-professional photographer. I bought this camera as the camera that is always with me. To that end it is good. It is a very small camera and has features that are important such as wide angle view, fairly good in low light and is HD video capable. The still image quality is good but not any where's near as good as my Canon 60D (nor was I expecting that). That said I guess I hoped it would be a little bit better. The HD video is very good. Better than I expected. Just don't zoom in and out and expect the focus system to catch up. Once you plan your shots this is not a problem because you can cut the out of focus parts easily. Over all compared to my now retired SD800IS it is a much better camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Power in a Small, Stylish Package
Item.Review: It's a tiny little black box with a rough exterior (literally) and a powerful interior. If you're looking for a good camera that you want to have with you at all times, this is the one. It's ultra-compact design makes it impossible to have any excuse for not always having it within arm's reach. When you grab this thing, you know that it's not going anywhere and if it does take a spill, it can handle it. So, about the quality of the photos. Having used nothing but a DSLR for the past 3 years, my judgement of ANY point-and-shoot camera is a bit skewed. But when I put my mind back to the time of my last point-and-shoot, I can appreciate the quality of this camera's output. Images are sharp and true to their color reproduction of their subjects. Another pleasant surprise was the file s ... ize of the images. On the average, they're about 2MB which I think is pretty amazing considering their resolution is 4000x3000. Additionally, the high-speed video capture that plays back in super slow motion is a VERY interesting feature that many point and shoots are featuring, but is great to have in this little powerhouse. In summary, if you're looking for a compact, durable, stylish camera that captures high-quality images, I think you're going to be more than satisfied with this choice. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Comparable in size to a cell phone, this camera is easy to have with you wherever and whenever. Photos have good contrast and color, works well in well-to medium lit interiors and full to shaded outdoors. I have not yet tried it in true low light. While the intelligent focus system seemed to work pretty well, I was able to figure out how change the default to spot focus mode, which is what I prefer. Both methods seemed to give a nice sharp focus. I cannot speak about the flash, I turned it off immediately and have never used it. The focus assist light is very bright, enough to be plainly visible even in well-lit rooms. While it is not a super SLR or my large-format sheet-film camera, it does a very good job at everything it is supposed to do that I have had a chance to try.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great manual settings
Cons: Battery life is decent but not outstanding
This is an amazing point and shoot camera. I have always been a Canon user and recently upgraded my little point and shoot camera. There is a learning curve for the manual settings but once you get a hold of the features, the variety of pictures you can take is unlimited. If you are not extremely steady with your hands on some of these manual settings, however, beware that your pics will be blurry. Overall this was a perfect buy at a great price point. Once again, Canon did not disappoint!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera at a Great Price
Item.Review: I debated on forking over the money to get a G12 but my husband was against it since i have broken my past 2 sony cameras. I went to BB knowing I wanted one similar to the SD1400 and was told this was the best choice. Only had it a week and have used it mostly for pictures of my fast moving 1 year old and also for HD video. VERY pleased with the low light setting and also the kids/pets feature! It is so small and easy to have in my purse at all times to capture my daughters milestones!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera for wife who needed 24mm wide point & shoot. Disappointed in overexposed full auto---set Program mode for her instead. Long-lasting battery life, useful zoom. Video and audio very good and slow motion feature makes camera worth the price of admission. It's amazing to see the complex movement of birds taking flight with every frame a photograph. Location of flash too easy to cover with finger--takes getting used to. Even in Program Mode, you can only choose one feature at a time. The big negative ? CANON DOESN'T PROVIDE A HARDCOPY INSTRUCTION MANUAL !! You have to look at PDF instructions from included disc, call Canon and wait for 3-weeks for them to send a manual in 8-1/2x11 pages or print all 214 pages yourself. Canon explained that they're a green comp ... any and shifting the hardcopy burden to the buyer. What's next? Bringing a shopping bag so retailer can hand you the camera kit in pieces? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is a great back up to my DSLR when I don't feel like lugging it around. Great for taking family snap shots just about anywhere. Easy to carry, takes great pictures and the HD video is also outstanding for a camera of this size. I will bring this on my trip to Disney so I can leave the bulky DSLR in the hotel room for a day or two and enjoy the parks!! I'll still be able to take great photos while walking around and going on the attractions as this camera fits easily into a shirt pocket. It does not replace a DSLR in any way shape or form! It's just simply a great little back up camera for when the DSLR is just a bit too much. I really have no complaints about this camera as it does everything that I expected from an incredibly small point & shoot camera. I find this camera ... to be very useful in many places. expand » « collapse

Battery life is better than expected. We haven't tried to use it in Program mode yet, but automatic point-and-shoot is good. Takes much better pictures than the more expensive Sony we replaced. My only complaint is that the pictures seem to be a little too saturated as far as color is concerned, but nothing a little Photoshop can't handle for the ones we want to print.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera a couple of weeks ago before my vacation to Colorado and I love it. It is so easy to use and learn all of the functions. There is one function that I am not used to, the panoramic stitch mode. It helps with the creation of panoramic photos by allowing you to line up a number of different photos. You need a computer program to actually create the panoramic look. I wish it had a panoramic mode that worked directly on the camera. All of the other functions are awesome. The photos come out so clear and beautiful. The battery life could be better. I have been messing with it a lot because it's new, so that may have something to do with it. I bought the black camera, which has a rough texture to it. I wasn't sure if I liked it at first but now I am used to it. It doesn't ... bother me at all. It makes the camera feel more durable and you can get a better grip on it. Overall, this is a GREAT camera. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy to use camera that takes beautiful pictures. It's worth every penny! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small and simple
Cons: Slow reload speed
This camera does what I want it to: take pictures without my thinking about it, in all light conditions. The metering is pretty sophisticated, though it's sometimes annoying to tell it that you want to decide where to meter. Low light quality is also pretty excellent. If you don't have delerium tremens, you can be reasonably assured you'll get a good shot without the flash anywhere. The lag time between shots is sometimes slow (my wife would say all the time), but admittedly, I've not tried to find the "take pictures fast" setting. I never thought I'd say this, but the camera is so low profile that it's sometimes hard to hold onto. Be careful on the boat, in other words. Fits in the pocket really nicely, though. I like the range ... of zoom - zoomed all the way out is fairly wide-angle, and slightly fisheye. Battery needs to be removed to recharge, which is one of the ways Canon makes it so small. expand » « collapse

( Unlike one of the previous re ... veiwers, I did like the rougher feel of the black case. It made it more secure to hold still especialy outdoors in misty weather.) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

I do alot of video/slideshow productions, and I love the quality of the video on this camera. Took great video in low light at a concert. The slow motion video feature is so fun, just wish it had sound. Some reviews complain about the smallness of the buttons (for example the zoom in/out), but I have never found this to be a problem. Photo quality is great, but I still prefer my Canon SLR for important photo shoots. But you can't beat the size, convenience of this camera for capturing everyday events.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: The best point and shoot I've owned!

Most shots end up looking quite prfessional. Had another Cannon before this and it was awful. They really went up in value in the last couple years. Absolutely love it!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Hmmm, different from the previous model
Item.Review:
Pros: A slim (fits in the pocket) camera with good HD video. Takes very good pics for a point-and-shoot. Nice that the lens is 5X (4.3 to 21.5 mm).
Cons: Slightly larger than my previous Canon ELPH the SD780 IS. Longer, wider and fatter. Not as good a feel as the previous one, and seems less well made. The buttons in my two-year-old model were metal, these are plastic. To shoot video in the old one, you simply put the setting from AUTO to the video icon, in this one, you must first put it to AUTO and then push another button, a small matter, but I suspect indicative of other less elegant design features.
I bought this camera to replace my beloved Canon ELPH SD780 IS. I had that one about two years and it took great pics, slid easily into my pocket, and was so simple an ... d easy to use. This new one, while with slightly better specs (lens, etc) seems to have been not as well designed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my wife for everyday picture taking. We took the camera for a spin on our vacation to Hawaii. The things that are great about it: (1) It's very compact and lightweight, so it goes everywhere and easily fits in pockets and purses. Be warned, if you have large hands you might not like it or find it too small. (2) Picture quality is pretty good. It seems to handle outdoor and low-light situations pretty well. Haven't taken a very close look at the pictures yet, but at a glance they look good, colors are vivid and not washed out (a previous P&S camera we had would consistently deliver washed-out colors). (3) It's simple enough to use with no mucking around, yet has various creative modes (including 'P' or Program mode) that let you set things like ISO, flash, etc. ... Obviously it's not as flexible as the higher-end P&S cameras or DSLRs, but for beginners or people who don't want to mess too much with settings it's IMHO a great camera. (4) Optical zoom range is good - wide is wide for landscape shots, zoom gets you sufficiently close to the action, and the IS helps you keep it steady. (5) Video quality is pretty good - I shot in 720p with no lag, and playback on camera and on PC seems good and smooth. (6) LCD is nice and big and bright. The main complaint, and it's a huge one, is that focusing is SLOW. I'm talking amost 1/2 a second to acquire focus. Once it's there though, taking the actual shot is quick. However, I think we missed capturing a good number of fleeting moments due to the slow focus. Other minor complaints: In some wide-angle shots with flash, the lens actually interferes and casts a shadow on parts of the shot. It's readily apparent on some shots, but I think for the most part you might not notice. Also there's no optical viewfinder, but we use the LCD 100% of the time, so this doesn't bother us at all. Despite the focus lag, I think this is a pretty good camera for someone who wants a compact, lightweight camera to take on vacation, or for everyday shooting where you don't want to deal with a variety of settings. If quick focus is important to you, there are other P&S cameras with faster times, or you may want a consumer/prosumer DSLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I finally found a perfect compact point and shoot
Item.Review:
Pros: images(low light and macro)
Cons: menu set up is confusing at first
I was trying to decide between the Canon s95, the canon sx230 hs and this one. The S95 is great if you want to spend the money and want a lot of control, but the video is just ok and has only 3.8x zoom. The sx230 hs is a little cheaper has 14x zoom and full HD video, but I found the images underwhelming and low light photos are still very grainy. Also the GPS is not essential. The Elph 300hs does not have all the manual features or the mega zoom but if I wanted that I would just get a DSLR. The pictures(both low light and macro) and video are excellent, the lcd is clear and bright, and it is almost HALF the price of the s95.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is replacing a similarly-sized Panasonic point and shoot from a couple years ago. Compared to the Panasonic, this has significantly less noise in low-light shots, a bit more zoom, a bit wider angle, and better video. I was up in the air between this one and larger superzoom model. I waited until I could see both in person, and picked this one. Simple reason: this Canon takes infinitely better pictures than any camera that isn't with me at the time. I'm just more likely to carry this camera with me than something that doesn't fit in my pocket. This size camera is a compromise: it takes significantly better pictures than a cell phone camera, but doesn't have the zoom or flash power of a larger camera. It's still small enough that I can justify carrying in my pocket in addition to ... my cell phone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this camera for General photos of my kids and outdoor activities, it is small lightweight and very practical. The whole body feels like a rough skin, sort of..makes it easy to handle even when not looking at it. Beautiful color rich photos, the only drawback is that I can't control the resolution until I load them on the computer.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Easy To Use; Large Clear LCD; Small / Compact
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay; Poor Image Quality
Well, Let's begin with the Pros: Fits great in my pockets, very slim and compact! This is the initial reason I was attracted to it and paid [$] It takes decent pictures in daylight and well lit rooms.Cons: I expected the photo quality to be a lot better from this Canon. Unfortunately it did not meet my expectations. It's terrible in low light. It takes for ever to auto focus in a dim rooms like bars which is where I primarily wanted to use it. So, I find myself trying to take a pic and it could take many many seconds before the picture is taken. It's a bummer. Also the color quality isn't what I have expected from a Canon camera. I own 3 older models and are muc ... h happier with them. Unfortunately I can't comment on the video becuase I haven't really used it. If this camera broke today...I would not buy it again.Dennis Jarrin expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
This camera has everything you could want in a sweet little size at a very reasonable price. The highlights for me:
- low light sensitivity...they are not kidding this is awesome for night shots but also for low light situations where other cameras will auto flash and overexpose. Just point and shoot, no fiddling with settings.
- automatic macro...get in close and it switches to macro on its own. This is really handy for a plant lover like myself. Its macro is also very decent.
- 1080p HD with stereo sound. Need I say more? Check out reviews/videos on youtube and you'll see what I mean.
I LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera. I bet you will, too. And by the way, Dell.com offered the best price at the time and shipped really quickly. I got a bundle with a case and 8GB SD c ... ard. It was only offered in silver and I preferred the red but I will live. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would continue purchase CANON products
Item.Review: I have an older ELPH 500 and still use it. I like the quality of pictures, the camera size, ease of use, and the screen size of the ELPH 300. It's great to have a small camera to put in the pocket and have available to take pictures in moments indoors or out. It is also easy to download pictures onto the computer or to a printer.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon Powershot 300 HS Digital ELPH RED
Item.Review: I have had the camera about 2 weeks. I love it. It is easy to use and takes great pics. My 2 previous cameras were Canon and so I already know how great the pics are. The software from my PS SD870 IS was much easier to use, but I will get used to this newer upgrade to the Zoom Browser I hope. I have not used all of the options it has, but love the fact that I can use auto or choose the settings myself. I also like the children/pets mode for faster shooting of moving pets and children. The 229 price was well worth it for this camera. The camera is VERY thin and might be a little small for people with big hands, but I have small hands and it fits perfectly. It is small enough for my purse or a pocket.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, features, quality
Cons: Can't always trust auto setting to capture people clearly. Can not use two settings at once
After wanting to throw my three Kodak's against the wall for ruining so many precious family moments, I did hours of research and settled on this camera. I am loving it! I've had it for about two weeks and highly enjoy playing with it. It's easy to use although it took me a time or two to get "speedy" with the changing of settings; I was used to the Kodak settings. I am adoring the color effect and vivid settings--two I wasn't sure I'd ever use. The scenery shots I have taken--especially in vivid--are stunning. The optical zoom during video make a very slight buzzing sound but if you have other noise going on in the video, you hardly notice it ... (if at all!) and it doesn't cut out the main audio you want to capture (unlike my Kodak optical that would totally override the desired audio with a loud cranking sound) I do advise you be careful when taking pictures of people. I had mine on auto today instead of portrait with face AiAF enabled and unfortunately it made the background trees crystal clear while blurring the people. It was a one time shot of a group of preschool children posing infront of a Redwood. I am very upset it did that but lesson learned: Take the extra second to put it on portrait; don't trust auto to always make people crystal clear. Otherwise my only other "complaint" is not being able to use two features at once such as fisheye in black and white or sepia. I'd love to be in a monotone setting and be able to use another setting with it. I really would have given this camera a 4 1/2 stars out of five if I could have. Four is not quite giving it the justice it deserves. *Reminder* invest in a good class 10 SD card for write time and storage space (there is no internal memory). Those 1080 videos take up a lot of room! (Sidenote--I personally love the rougher black texture) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
My husband and I have always been partial to Canon cameras even though we've had Nikon and other popular brand cameras in the past. We currently own the Rebel Ti and use that as our main "pro photo" equipment. We also hike, backpack, rock climb, kayak, and these activities require a lightweight point and shoot camera that can capture the usually momentary scenes that catch our eye - so we bought this one.
The pictures are crisp, colors are true, and the optical zoom is great. We've taken a wide range of pics from macros of budding flowers and insects to panoramics at various times of the day and the pictures come out very well. Of course, you need to know how to use the camera and the settings are easy to figure out if you've been using Canon for a while. People who see our adventur ... e pics frequently ask what we take our pictures with and they are surprised when we tell them we use an ELPH point and shoot. Not only that, maybe only 1% (one percent!) of the time would we have to do any post-shoot image editing.
There are a copule of caveats - if you have big hands, manipulating the camera could be tricky. This is also not a rugged camera you can drop (we've dropped one before on a hiking trip and that was the end of it) and expect it to survive. I would recomment rugged waterproof housing for the camera - but it's worth the extra weight. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Small / Compact; Easy To Use
Cons: No Viewfinder; Lag / Shutter Delay
This is a great replacement for my Canon 600. The image quality is remarkably good. The HD video quality was surprisingly good. The camera is great in low light. Hard to frame in bright light with no viewfinder.
The lag time for action shots make it unacceptable for sporting events. The extra wide field of view make good landscape or group shots but poor for wild life shots. Be careful when using video not to place your fingers on the top of the camera. The stereo microphones pickup the noise clearly. The camera focused really well in low light for both video and still shots!
All-in-all the camera is great ... for some things and not so well suited for others. If it fits your needs it is a superb little camera. It will do the same as a new flip video camera as well as a good point and shoot camera all in one!
The NB-4L battery fits many older Canon cameras so you may already have a few lying around. The SDHC uses the newest chips. A 16GB class 10 will take more than 6000 images and/or an hour of video. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought the Elph as a shower gift for my granddaughter and her husband. Perfect for photos and videos of the coming baby! They were delighted by its size and the zoom abilities--the wider angle was a hit. Also, they plan to use Auto mostly as they want to focus on the behavior of the baby. It is so compact it will be always with them and of course the perfect camera is the one you actually have with you when something you want to record actually happens

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes good pics
Cons: In auto mode, slaow to take pic
Have not played with all features, but pics look pretty good and it is neat to go between the manual and auto settings, then to record video. Only complaint is some times taking pics in auto is a little sluggish because I think it is trying to do a lot of evaluation so the best picture can be taken. Due to the sluggishness, some times those "important" shots may have been missed. Battery life is awesome as well. Have not checked out how the video is on TV though.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for getting quick shots
Item.Review:
Pros: Small size makes it easy to carry
Easy to use. Fits nicely in a pocket. Turns on quickly. Super slow mo video is nice for sports (filming Little League pitchers). Lots of different photo option settings.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The pictures
Cons: The lense retraction breaks so easily. I have owned 4 and have all died in less than a year because of the lense.
This camera is compact and fits in your pocket. It takes great pictures in all light. But it lasts less than a year if you are active at all or have children. If it is dropped or knocked over whether the camera is on or off, the lense is affected and it will not retract anymore. The camera will not operate if the lense malfunctions. I have had 4 in three years. 2 died within the purchased warranty period. I will not buy another one.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Awesome little pocket camera. Purchased as a pre-wedding gift for my sister. I took a bunch of pics during the ceremony and reception, they came out great. Semi-rough/textured surface helps keep a solid grip on the camera. Only issue is its natural to cover the flash with your finger, but easy to get used to. The newlyweds took the camera to the Cayman Islands on their honeymoon and all the pics look beautiful. Overall, very compact and great photos and build quality for the price.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Been looking for a pocket camera for a while now. Sometimes, it's great to have a compact camera were the need to take along full SLR gear is not needed. The Powershot 300 HS fits the bill very well. The camera is extremely easy to use. Images are clear and crisp, even if just left in Auto! The modes under the Program mode are great to have some fun with as well. As a SLR user, it was mentally hard not being in control all the time, but it was a pleasant surprise at the results of this camera. Well worth it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, price, features, photo quality, ease of use
Cons: Nothing!
Bought this camera to have a smaller camera to take on a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Jamaica. Could not have been happier! Easy to use, lightweight, took GREAT pictures (and I have a history of "shaky" photographs) For the price, you simply can't beat it. Buy with confidence.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: CMOS, small size
Cons: Video not in MP4 or AVI format
This is the most compact, sleek, and slim CMOS pocket camera in the consumer market. In terms of size, portability, and function, this is about as perfect as I know. It also takes night city light pictures fairly well without a tripod. In summary, an awesome little camera good for day and night.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Such awesome quality for it's price.
Cons: Have to make sure the camera is focused before recording video.
I use this camera as a vlogger on YouTube and I wouldn't recommend anything else higher than this. The camera is such great quality for it's price it's almost like I'm stealing the camera from Best Buy! 1080p is true 1080p quality unlike some cameras out there. This is the perfect camera for anybody, even professionals out there who just need a small cheap second camera for small stuff. Just make sure you buy the warranty with it, it scratches up very easily. I used it almost daily for about 8 or 9 months before it was dropped multiple times and died. They replaced my camera in the store with the accidental warranty. Easy to use, great quality camera for sure.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, Feel, Pictures, Filters
I have wanted a Canon Powershot for like ever and finally got this one! I absolutely love it & couldn't be happier especially with the price :)

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: It's a great camera for the price
Item.Review:
I bought this camera for a vacation and it was perfect along with my 16GB SDHC card. I didn't need to take videos/images off the camera until I was back home.
The one thing I like about the camera was that I was able to edit the videos right on the camera such as trimming the videos or splitting them into two. I love this feature as space might be taken up by unnecessary footage and I create space even when I don't have access to a computer.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: This is a compact camera with a powerful zoom. It is super slim and is a point and shoot that produces very crisp pictures similar to the quality of the more costly larger cameras. The small size lets you either carry it around on your wrist with the included strap or slip it easily into your purse or pocket.
Cons: Haven't found one yet.
Review: Super camera super price!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, great price, fast picture taking WITH accuracy
Cons: Well it's small so maybe it's easier to lose?
It knocked my Nikon S6200 out of the water! The pictures were about the same quality BUT the Canon is so much easier to use. I had to take the pictures "just right" with the Nikon and it ALWAYS wanted to focus on anything BUT my intended subject. The Canon not only quickly focuses, takes pics, and is ready for the next shot in a snap, but it also follows the subjects if you want it to, and has an amazing burst mode. This is the best compact camera I've had. Better than my Cyber-shots too. And, if you get it on sale, it's worth the price! I did have reservations about the 5x optical zoom. The Nikon had 10X but honestly it's not a huge difference when you tak ... e into account the quality of pictures is higher on the Canon expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use
Cons: wish it had a view finder. I like that better than using the screen for framing my shots.
I love this camera. I have been searching for a camera that will hold it's charge and take good pictures. This camera was easy to use right out of the box. The rechargeable battery does not take long to charge. The pictures come out well and I really like the zoom on this. Plus it fits into my back pocket!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Very compact and handy, I take it everywhere instead of lugging my DSLR all the time. Make sure you have a fast SDHC card. The camera has an array of useful scene modes, also the slow motion video capability is very interesting and entertaining. It takes a little bit exploring to study the menu, once you get it, it's a breeze. The black body has sand-papery feeling to it, the red and silver ones are smooth.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: great camera for the average user
Item.Review: this is perfect for the on-the-go person who snaps photos all the time. it's actually pretty small so it fits everywhere. it takes clear pictures and has many features. the movie mode with 1080 makes this an enticing camera. a very versatile piece for the average user. You will get a lot of use.
